trans-unit.source: Quick Reference for Frequently Used Commands for Import Jobs

trans-unit.source: This section provides a quick references for some frequently used commands.

trans-unit.target: Copy a Single Directory to a Hard Drive

trans-unit.source: Copy Two Directories to a Hard Drive
trans-unit.target: Copy Two Directories to a Hard Drive

trans-unit.source: To copy two source directories to a drive, you will need two commands.
trans-unit.target: To copy two source directories to a drive, you will need two commands.

trans-unit.source: The first command specifies the log directory, storage account key, target drive letter and <codeInline>format/encrypt</codeInline> requirements, in addition to the common parameters:
trans-unit.target: The first command specifies the log directory, storage account key, target drive letter and <codeInline>format/encrypt</codeInline> requirements, in addition to the common parameters:

trans-unit.source: The second command specifies the journal file, a new session ID, and the source and destination locations:
trans-unit.target: The second command specifies the journal file, a new session ID, and the source and destination locations:
